activities.text: Sunrise hike to the summit (4.4 km)

activities.text: Hot air balloon flight at sunrise over the hinterland

activities.text: Observation of wild koalas in eucalyptus trees

activities.text: Sailing cruise in the Whitsundays islands

Beaches bordered by tropical rainforest

activities.text: Skydiving with views of the Great Barrier Reef and tropical rainforest

seo.h1_title: The Great Australian Coastal Journey: Road Trip from the Twelve Apostles to the Reef
seo.intro_paragraph: Drive the Great Ocean Road and its cliffs, discover Melbourne and Sydney, hike the Blue Mountains, surf Byron Bay and dive the Great Barrier Reef from Cairns. Australia's east coast, from south to tropical north.
seo.seo_hook: Limestone cliffs plunge into the ocean, rainforest opens onto coral gardens, from mountain mist to tropical heat. Australia's east coast is an endless spectacle.

itineraries.title: Australia's Kimberley 4x4 Trail: Gibb River Road, Bungle Bungles & Mitchell Falls

visits.text: Derby - port town, western gateway to the Gibb River Road
Mowanjum Aboriginal Art and Cultural Centre - Aboriginal art and culture

activities.text: Tourist information center - road conditions and status
Trip preparation - fuel and water supply

visits.text: Bandilngan National Park (Windjana Gorge) - 3.5 km gorge in an ancient Devonian reef
Dimalurru (Tunnel Creek) - oldest cave system in Western Australia (750 m)

activities.text: Gorge Walk Trail - 7 km return hike
Tunnel Creek exploration - through cave with underground river
Jandamarra historical site - 19th century Aboriginal warrior

visits.text: Wunaamin Miliwundi Ranges Conservation Park - Kimberley mountain range
Lennard Gorge - steep gorge with natural pool

activities.text: Inglis Gap lookout - panoramic view over the ranges

visits.text: Bell Gorge - multi-tiered waterfall and natural pools
Mount Hart Homestead - historic estate at the foot of Mt Matthew

activities.text: Swimming in the pools of Bell Gorge
Matthew Gorge - isolated gorge near Mount Hart
Bird watching in the rainforest pocket
Hike at the foot of Mt Matthew

visits.text: Galvans Gorge - accessible waterfall and natural pool
Manning Gorge - gorge with upper and lower waterfalls

activities.text: Guided hike to Upper Manning Gorge
River crossing by raft to the waterfalls

visits.text: Mornington Wilderness Camp - 3000 km² tropical savanna reserve
Dimond Gorge - spectacular gorge of the region
Mt Elizabeth Station - historic cattle station
Wunnumurra Gorge and Warlu Gorge - sacred Aboriginal gorges
Drysdale River Station - gateway to Mitchell River National Park

activities.text: Mitchell Falls - four-tiered waterfalls (scenic flight or hiking)
Mitchell and King Edward Rivers - barramundi fishing
Scenic flight over Prince Regent River

visits.text: Ellenbrae Station - traditional cattle station
Home Valley Station - estate at the foot of the Cockburn Ranges

activities.text: Cockburn Ranges panorama - red sandstone escarpments

visits.text: Pentecost River crossing - iconic ford passage
El Questro Wilderness Park - 400,000 hectare nature reserve

activities.text: Zebedee Springs - natural hot springs in a palm gorge
Emma Gorge - hike to waterfall and natural pool
Chamberlain Gorge - boat cruise on the gorge

visits.text: Kununurra - oasis town of East Kimberley
Lake Argyle - Australia's largest artificial reservoir (18 times the volume of Sydney Harbour)
Wyndham - historic port and Five Rivers Lookout

activities.text: Purnululu National Park (Bungle Bungle) - UNESCO-listed sandstone domes (250 km)
Scenic flight over the Bungle Bungle
Lake Argyle cruise - freshwater crocodile watching
Ord River - navigation on 55 km of waterways
Mirima National Park - mini Bungle Bungle 2 km from the center

seo.h1_title: Australia's Kimberley 4x4 Trail: Gibb River Road, Bungle Bungles & Mitchell Falls
seo.intro_paragraph: Take the Gibb River Road, a legendary adventure: Windjana's spectacular gorges, Bell Gorge's hidden pools, Manning's cliffs and El Questro lodge. The Kimberley is Australia's wildest frontier.
seo.seo_hook: Red earth stretches endlessly, gorges carve deep canyons, hidden waterfalls sing. The remote Kimberley road reveals Australia's primitive soul.

Darwin - capital of the Northern Territory, gateway to the Top End

activities.text: Snorkeling and diving on coral reefs

visits.text: Injalak Hill - major rock art site

activities.text: Ethical Adventures tours in Marrithiyal territory

visits.text: Fremantle - historic port and Victorian architecture

activities.text: Kings Park and Botanic Garden - 400 hectares of urban bush

visits.text: 63 white sand beaches and 20 bays
12 inland salt lakes
Coral Bay - coastal village at the entrance to Ningaloo Reef

activities.text: Cycling on the island's bike paths

visits.text: Ningaloo Marine Park - 260 km coral reef UNESCO listed
Ningaloo Marine Park - 260 km coral reef UNESCO listed

activities.text: Snorkeling directly from the beach on the reef
More than 500 species of fish and 400 types of coral
More than 500 species of fish and 400 types of coral

seo.h1_title: Australia's Grand Tour: Iconic Landscapes & Cultural Highlights
seo.intro_paragraph: Melbourne and its gardens, Cairns and the Barrier Reef, Kakadu and its Aboriginal sites, Darwin, Perth and its beaches, Rottnest's quokkas, Coral Bay's reefs. Cross Australia and discover all its diversity.
seo.seo_hook: Aboriginal stories etched in stone, tropical reefs teeming with life, a vast and empty outback. Australia's grand tour crosses ancient, living lands.

seo.h1_title: Sydney to Great Barrier Reef: Australia's Ultimate Coastal Road Trip
seo.intro_paragraph: Sydney and its opera house, Byron Bay and its waves, the Gold Coast, Whitsunday Islands, Mission Beach rainforest and diving at Cairns. Australia's east coast is a permanent spectacle.
seo.seo_hook: Coral gardens bloom beneath warm waves, rainforest whispers ancient secrets, island peaks pierce a turquoise sky. The east coast is Australia's crown jewel.

seo.h1_title: Southwest Australia Road Trip: Dramatic Cliffs and Ancient Karri Forests
seo.intro_paragraph: Taste Margaret River wines, admire spring wildflowers, walk among Walpole's giant trees and relax on Denmark's beaches. Southwest Australia offers deep forests and wild coasts.
seo.seo_hook: Century-old karris reach for the sky, white sand cliffs plunge into turquoise bays, wine ripens under a blazing sun. Southwest Australia breathes wilderness.
